I was wondering why the banner you've included on the thread seems to be familiar looking and it was because it's the banner being shown on the forum itself. Anyways, since you're already a copper member why not add some pictures and illustrations of your gambling platform on your thread to attract more users to the forum. comments.author: Bitinity
comments.body: Quote from: BetCoco on September 19, 2022, 10:20:33 AMKYC is applicable for both, fiat and crypto users. Anyways, you can always deposit and play without the need of verifying your account When you hit a win and want to withdraw funds, you'll need to do KYC. BetCoCo can take up to 3 days to verify the accounts, although usually takes around 24 hours I guess this will be your first own enemy to get the interest from crypto gamblers. There are still many crypto gamblers who do not want to play in a site where KYC is mandatory for withdrawal. I think you need to change this or at least modify it a bit to attract crypto gamblers. Lets say give a withdrawal limit for KYC, so small players will also be attracted to play in your site. It does not worth for small gamblers to complete KYC just to withdraw few tens/hundreds dollars. Anyway, welcome to the bitcointalk community.

comments.author: seoincorporation
comments.body: You should mention the rollover requirement on the depo bonus.QuoteThe wagering requirements have a minimum of 25 times the amount of bonus and the real money sum contributing to the bonus figure.So, if a user makes a 0.5BTC depo they get 1 btc to play with, but they have to wager 25btc.And another thing important to mention is the max win from the no depo bonus:QuoteThe maximum amount of money to be won from a no deposit free spin bonus and gameplay with mentioned bonus funds is 50 EUR or any other currency equivalent. Any winnings exceeding 50 EUR without making a real money deposit will be void and will be kept by BetCoCoI don't like at all the fact that wins bigger than $250 require KYC for withdraw, is like searching for a excuse to not allow users to withdraw.

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: I've seen about BetCoCo casino on Casino.guru, at first there were no complaints about BetCoCo casino, but today I tried to check again about BetCoCo gambling site reviews, strangely I found complaints about BetCoCo, as below.casino.guru/betcoco casino reviewQuoteWarning: BetCoco Casino has certain sections of Bonus Terms and Conditions that we consider to be unfair to the casino's players. These might cause you issues if you decide to take advantage of the casino's bonuses or promotions. Because of this, we advise you to look for a casino with fair rules or at least pay special attention to this casino's Terms and Conditions if you decide to play at it.Of course I'm not accusing BetCoCo casino of a scam or not, bottom line: what I saw in casino.guru reviews is questionable, so that users who take advantage of the 0.5 BTC bonus and those who bet need to be considered carefully, in order to avoid problems in the future.For a while, I haven't been able to consider betting on the BetCoCo site, maybe, if one day it looks normal and safe, I will consider, I look at sports betting, that's a point for me.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: Quote from: seoincorporation on September 19, 2022, 01:31:53 PMI don't like at all the fact that wins bigger than $250 require KYC for withdraw, is like searching for a excuse to not allow users to withdraw. Since they have mention this, it makes sense. If you are playing here, you are knowingly playing that you may have gone through KYC if you win big. However, I too perosnally don't like to go through KYC just to gamble in a casino. There are a lot of other sites out there where I can gamble big without KYC. Why would I not join them? Betcoco must consider this as a crypto casino.
